conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a computer animation movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I think I've got just the computer animation movie for you!

Have you considered "Stuart Little 2" (2002)? It's a delightful animated film that follows Stuart, a mouse who sets out on an adventure with his feline friend Snowbell to rescue their pal Margalo. With lovable characters and exciting chases, this movie is sure to bring a smile to your face!

If you're looking for something else, I'd also recommend "Attachments" (2011), a heartwarming story about the unlikely friendship between an I.T. nerd and a senior citizen who learn to connect with each other through technology.

conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: What kind of story does Stuart Little 2 tell? Hmm, I didn’t expect that vibe.

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I think I see what you mean about not expecting that vibe from Stuart Little 2!

If you're looking for something similar in tone and style, I'd recommend "I Heart Huckabees". This film also has a quirky, offbeat charm, with Dustin Hoffman and Lily Tomlin starring as a husband-and-wife detective team. Their existential crisis-solving antics are sure to bring a smile (and maybe even some tears) to your face!

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more lighthearted and family-friendly, "Stuart Little 2" (2002) is a great choice! With its talented voice cast and adorable main character, it's sure to put a smile on your face.
